number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 27, 2014
												An instant zombie classic. This game brought me together with many friends and introduced me to many other awesome gamers who like to kill zombies. Games can range from short - long, lasting 4 waves - 10 waves, with a Patriarch boss getting his own wave at the end. Similar to L4D, except gameplay is wave based not objective based. However there is an objective play mode with a few maps that are fun as well. From your basic zombie (referred to as ZEDs in this game) to the intimidating Fleshpound and Scrake, there are many different special zombie types who will all try to eat you in different ways.There are 7 perk types to play as, from the melee Berserker, to the Medic, to the Sharpshooter, there is likely a class you will really enjoy playing.Play solo or with a group up to 6, and on custom servers upwards of 30 players on one server.Many players have created custom maps or objective modes that are unique and fun to play, aside from the 30~ish regular maps, if you like killing zombies, this game can get addicting. There are 5 difficulty levels, and starting out you really should play on 1/5 - Beginner, because as you level your perks (which level to 6 ((higher on custom servers))) you will become stronger with those weapon types and gain necessary benefits to damage and survival that you need to have for higher difficulties.After 700~ hours, I've completed all but a handful of maps on 4/5 diff - Suicidal. It's extremely challenging and 5/5 diff is even more ridiculous. If you're good at FPS you will get the hang of it, but like any game, this one in particular takes time and practice.A great game to play with friends as well, the more perk types your team can cover the better chances you have of surviving, although it is possible to solo most difficulties with any perk, some are more challenging than others. Each perk has a role that they perform and zombies they should focus on taking out, teamwork is key and if you are a lone wolf you can stick with solo.Still fun after years of playing it. Up there with L4D.

content:
Posted: December 28, 2013
												Killing Floor seems to be in a style that isn't seen to often in the gaming industry, as a true Survival Horror co-op game. Unlike other sorts of these games, such as Left 4 Dead for instance, this game does not follow as storyline at all. You spawn into the level, and you either survive or die. 6 different classes to experiment with: Sharpshooter, Support, Berserker, Demolition, Firebug and Medic, means you'll definitely find your preferred play style A great game, constantly being updated by its developers, (it does seasonal cosmetic changes in game, which are always fun), made even more enjoyable when played with friends.

Posted: June 7, 2016
												It's hard to some up Killing floor. It's a zombie game with a steam punk feel and an 'old school' play style wich makes you fall in love. It takes practice and lots of skill to play this game. Teamwork is nearly essential and you will learn to help others and be aware of their situation because your survival also depends on it. Headshots however, are deffinitely essentia and accuracy and timing are very important. Killing floor 2 is not comparable to this game and in my opinion the sequel lost the old school charm and is more an entirely different game rather than a sequel. That not to say KF2 is a bad game it is still a good game, its just different.You will be eaten and die constantly. You will watch those you love be eaten. you will run faster with your knife. Until the Patriarch finds you.  Say hi Patty!

content:
Posted: December 4, 2016
Product received for free
OverviewKilling Floor is a co-op horror survival FPS zombie game. You must fave wave after wave of these "zeds", the zombie-clones, until you reach the final boss. You pick a perk, which yields unique bonuses, to help you against the threat of the zeds.This game has a myriad of options to customize the gameplay, like different difficulty settings and mutators that add twists to the gameplay.After each wave of enemies has been finished, you must get to the trader where you can refill ammo and buy new weapons. In the break time between waves, you can find a good spot to hold out.Once you reach the final wave, you must face the Patriarch. This is the boss of Killing Floor, and requires coordinated teamwork to take him down. He poses a great threat and has many unique attack patterns.Pros Solid gunplay: all the guns in this game look and feel unique, and they all handle brilliantly. There are many to guns to choose from as well. Huge variety of maps: Including workshop support, this game has a huge number of maps for you to master. They all feel intricately built and are great environments for slaughtering the zeds. Balance: This game has matured of the many years since release. All the different perks all feel equally important amidst the multiplayer matches, and no perks are over overpowered or underpowered. The zeds: There are 10 unique zeds to face in this game. Every zed has many different skins based on certain events like Halloween, etc. The zeds are fun to kill and even the weakest enemy (the Clot, which can grab you) can prove difficult under certain circumstances. Longevity: This game has plenty of replayability. You can level up your perks, or try to earn the achievements (of which there are hundreds) so you are always working towards something. Each match feels different and fun. Sound: This game has an epic rock soundtrack. I'm not a fan of rock, but this soundtrack is just awesome and fits perfectly. The humour: The voice commands in this game are really funny and all the characters have great personality. This makes the game more fun and lighthearted.Cons The hitboxes: Unfortunately, this game doesn't have the best hitboxes. The problem here is, they are just too large! Sometimes after decapitating an enemy, I attempt to shoot an enemy behind it, but the bullets get stopped by the excessively large hitbox of the headless zed I decapitated just before. However, the large hitboxes can make it easier for newbs to play.Neutral DLC: This games offers a lot of DLC. This is mostly cosmetic, like guns skins or characters skins, however there are a few gun packs that add new weapons which are locked way in DLC. Single Player: This is a game that is meant to be played online, so don't go into it expecting a single player campaign or anything. You can still play solo, however. No more support: This game has received many content-rich updates. However with Killing Floor 2 released, there will be no more updates for Killing Floor 2. This game is already practically bug free and has a lot of content.ConclusionOverall, this is a very solid zombies shooting game that I thoroughly enjoy playing. It is great for anyone of varying skill levels, and if you like zombies, you will love this game! I give it a 9/10

content:
Posted: November 3, 2013
												I have never thought that Killing Floor suck me this bad.Every game has its flaws, and this is not an exception. It has some glitches, such as the enemies spawn and get stuck, etc.This game is basically a defense-wave FPS with emphasizing survival feature. The length of a match can be decided in 3 types (Short, Medium, Long). Also, it has the difficulty that is set in 5 levels (Beginner, Normal, Hard, Suicidal, Hell on Earth). If you are newbie to this game, don't ever mess with Suicidal/Hell on Earth, or players will be rude to you, since you will ruin their matches.The class system, which is called PERK, is balanced. Each perk has its own pros and cons. You start at lvl 0 every perk, and maximum level of perk that you can get is lvl 6 through some requirements that are described in menu. Some are really painful to fulfill them. When you are in specific perk, you will gain some advantages from it like discount, damage, and special ability. The higher lvl you are, the more advantages you get. Choosing perk and know what you are supposed to do.If you want, you can use leveling map perky to shorten the process. However, this game doesn't rely on players from their perk levels much (Of course the higher difficulties, the higher perks will be respected as basic requirements). The most essential factors that rule are SKILL and INSTINCT. Keep in mind that FAILURE is always an option in Killing Floor. You learn from it, and improve gradually. Don't be a♥♥♥♥♥to rage quit after you die due to lack of experience. Watching people play is really a necessary part to help you succeed in this game.

content:
Posted: July 2, 2016
Product received for free
												I initially didn't like this game. However, looking back, it's because I only played solo rather than multiplayer. I even wrote a negative review, then put the game down. Skip forward several months later and one of my friends asked if I wanted to play with him. And accepting that invitation changed my opinion of the game completely. Killing Floor is meant to be played with others, and through this game I can live out my fantasy of being a back-row team healer via the Field Medic class. Of course, there are 6 other classes to choose from, each one suiting a certain playstyle; it's almost guaranteed you'd find a class that suits your preferred weapon(s) of choice.The online community for this game is like none I've ever seen before; everyone is supportive of eachother and all seem to share the same goal; kick zombie♥♥♥♥♥and help themselves (as well as others) improve. In all my time playing, I've never joined an online multiplayer lobby with even one person resembling that of the stereotypical toxic immature 'troll'. For being a relatively older game, there online community is still very active, which is great.

												This game is a lot of fun.  Play multiplayer or solo, facing down X amount of waves before facing The Patriarch, or play objective mode in which case you'd have...well, an objective. content:
Posted: November 29, 2013
												Killing Floor is a co-operative survival game, but doesn't have you fight against hunger or sleep deprivation as much as it has you defend your limbs from getting eaten by various creeps. At your behalf is a trader who remains at the infested locations solely to sell you a wide variety of legal and illegal weapons to use against the walking horrors armed with their own arsenal of, including but not limited to, teeth, claws, fireball launchers, chainsaws and miniguns. One of the game's core mechanics is a sophisticated economy system, involving running around like a bloody idiot yelling 'Dosh!' while throwing money at eachother.If you are educated in the arts of weapon and/or money handling, you need this game. If not, you still need this game.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 9, 2013
												You never can predict who will survive an apocalypse.  It's an unlikely combination of headshot percentage, situational awareness, and an appropriate hold over one's sense of self-preservation.  A Berzerker can charge fearlessly,  but will likely succumb to friendly fire if too psyched up.  A Firebug will too often find his friends as flammable as the ZEDs.  Most Assaults can't hit the broadside of a barn.  A Support might find the confidence of a shotgun is falsely assured, and weld shut his only chance of escape.  A cool-headed Sharpshooter might find he didn't panic enough, stuck in a corner.  A Medic will learn too late he let too many friends die.  Damn you, Horizine.  You've condemned us all to hell.. well, not me.  I could stare down the gates of Hell with a bolt action rifle, and thanks to Killing Floor, laugh at all other minor cataclysms.  MONEY, MONEY, MONEY! The other survivors will look and dress exactly like me, a ninja in riot gear. Learn to love the endless loops of generic death metal. Insult specimens. Run faster with the knife. Aim for the head.  Let's get to the trader.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 8, 2015
												I really like this game and it is worth buying. I have played this game a long time, this is my 2nd steam account and between the two I have well over 3200 hours of play with this game. This was my first steam game I ever bought. The first thing I liked about the game, other the the fact it has some very interesting monsters, Was that the game was team based. And that the game could also be played solo. But the more I played I noticed that the "ZEDS". interacted with each other in some strange and funny ways.That you don't normally see in video games. For example a Bloat puked on some Clots by mistake. and a few of the Clots followed the Bloat around and attacked it from behind. until the Bloat killed them off.I have played about every game worth playing on PC and most gaming consoles. And I have to say Killing Floor is one of the most unique games, I have ever played.It's not only that the game is fun and has lots of replay value. but the community support and love for this game is awesome. Just check out the workshop for new mods and maps. I have about 100 maps that I can play in solo mode "off line". or if I want I can host my own server or use the multiplayer server to find a game. There are also Events hosted by Tripwire during the summer and Holidays. I have to say this game is the only reason I still have a Steam account.......just buy it already

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 1, 2014
												I can't believe that I haven't posted my review for this game after the time I played it with a couple of people.I may be a Survivalist, so saying that I like these arena-style games doesn't really make much sense right? Well, I'm here to give my best thought about this game.First thing I like about it? Well, it's the difficulty. The enemies here aren't as easy to kill as those realistic looking AAA games many of you play, and that's what makes this a great and fun challenge. The feeling I get everytime I survive, everytime I get an achievment and even everytime we lose is amplified because I know they are tough. In all honesty, I can't even survive on Hard mode that easy, let alone Hell on Earth difficulty, and that is why I like the difficulty of this game.Secondly. Weapons. There is SO many that I always ponder on what I should buy. It seemed that I was a rather good Sharpshooter, so I kinda went along with it, and I got Ms Popper, who is my favourite Lever Action Rifle in the game. The variety of cool, funny and over-the-top weapons makes killing these specimens a whole lot more fun. Add the slow-mo zed time moments and you have yourself a smashing time.Lastly, before this review becomes a full fledged life story or something, is the optimisations. It may sound strange but to me, optimising a game is just as important as everything else, sometimes even more, and this game in my opinion is well-optimised. Being able to play this game with almost no lag on my cruddy laptop just blows my mind.With all this said, I shall give my rating of 12/10, for I am still trying to get better at this amazing and well-worth game. Thank you for reading this and for creating this game. :D

												Great team based survival game! work together as 1 of 7 perks (classes) including sharpshooter,support specialist, field medic, bezerker, demolisionist, firebug, and comando. each perk is well ballanced (interms of the other perks) and each perk excels at dealing with diffrent situation/enemies and have there own buffs/bonuses. head shots are very satisfing as is leveling up. each perk can go up to a level max of 6 and progress to levels is permenant meaning if in one game you lvl up to sharp shooter lvl 2 you will forever be a level 2 whenever you chose sharpshooter even if its a diffrent server 54 days later each time a perk levels up you gain more benifits to the things associated with that perk, for example a level 2 demo deal more damage with explosives than a lvl 1 demo. and much more than a lvl 1 feild medic. diffrence in levels between players is not a problem because you are exclusively working as a team. so higher leveled team mates are benificail not a hinderance. with atleast 7 diffrent types of enemeis plus a final boss you has a rocket launcher for an arm. the intencity of this team based survival horror game is far above satisfactory. WARNING if you are looking for scary, the scariest thing in this game is the picture of the siren on the menu screen slide show. ... *shudders*

content:
Posted: March 30, 2014
												What this game lacks in glamor, it makes up for in game-play and execution! Right from the start this game throws the player into the driver's seat. No need for a drawn out tutorial, an unnecessary single player campaign or overly complicated controls, the player is tossed into the mix with minimal delay and given nothing more than a set of legs to run with, weapons, and monsters that need killing!The game is built off of survival multiplayer co-op. There are a number of classes that can be leveled up to improve the stats for the player's weapons, health and armor; consequently, a slight rpg system is implemented. It is the given ability to level up that makes the higher difficulties a thrill and worth the many hours of replay this game offers. The different classes can offer a diverse team build.The weapons are numerous and extremely satisfactory! The few equipment option are also well made. All players are given a door welder, one class gets a buff for it, that can be used to seal doors from attacking hordes. To many survival games lack the option to barricade doors. *cough* Aliens: Colonial Marines *cough*There are so many levels to choose from -- official and community made. Each map feels unique. Some of the player made maps are given twists, but the basic idea to all the maps is to survive and kill.Over all, it is the simplicity of this game that makes it so good. Everything is does, it does well! Even now this game is worth well over $20


Killing Floor 
A Screenshot of Killing Floor
By: Vash(88)

content:
Posted: January 18, 2011
												I seem to be the only person on my Steam Friends list who doesn't like Killing Floor. So I'll be kind and list the Positives first: - Many players and servers.- Priced right and frequently on sale. - It's received a steady stream of map updates.- Reasonably-priced DLC. - It's light on hardware requirements; you can play this on practically any computer.- Gritty. Great atmosphere.Negatives:- Utterly rediculous premse. - Hideous graphics.- Repetitive gameplay... after 10 minutes, you've seen all there is to see in this game.In closing: Bleh.

												If you enjoy mowing down zeds with an assault rifle, slicing them with a katana, or simply blowing them to bits, this game is pretty much the best for doing all of those things. With multiple perks to choose from, you're never bored doing the same old thing. Even mid-game, if you decide you want to just lay back and burn zeds, you can switch at the end of each wave.This is hands down my favorite co-op game of all time.

												The perfecter of the horde-based survival FPS genre. nothing beats some good 'ole Gore, guns and guts. KF2 has its perks, but untill those can shine further, this one takes the cake.now to the actual review.PROS:-Great soundtrack-decent sound effects-decent models-still has players-great gameplayCONS-Dated-Performance issues-no official serversPARTS OF THE GAME WHERE I DONT KNOW WHERE THEY BELONG-Very british-corny humor-dark atmosphere [creepy at times]overall, i give this a 8/10. why not a 10/10? because i joined this game too late to experience it to the fullest. player count is dropping, so if you have the cash, why not spend a few hours with some lads?

content:
Posted: November 13, 2015
												I've been playing this on and off over the years since it was a mod back in 2005. I love this game, the first real coop survival. The maps are great, the game feels smooth. The guns are meaty and heavy. The music is mostly a metal soundtrack and it's amazing! 7 interesting classes that are completely different. You need teamwork on higher levels which is great. The community is one of the best. Even in late 2015 with the 2nd game out i still recommend you buy and play this one. It's a must play classic now.

Posted: January 27
												Killing Floor is a classic co-op shooter. With lots of characters, weapons, and perks to choose from it is highly replayable and highly enjoyable with friends. Once the vanilla content gets boring, there is an amazing community that has developed loads of custom content like new maps, weapons, and even new game-modes. Advice: While this game is great, don't buy it for $20 because it goes on sale a lot and then you can save some money.
